'''Ledian''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''レディアン''' ''Redian'') is a dual-type {{2t|Bug|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Ledyba}} starting at [[level]] 18.

==Biology==
Ledian is a large, mostly red, ladybug-like Pokémon. It has two black antennae, a black neck, and a black spot in the center of its forehead. A female Ledian's antennae are shorter than those of a male. Its two eyes are large, blue, and slanted. It has four black arms with white hands clenched into fists. Its two legs are similar to its arms, but end with large red feet. Its back is red with large black spots, and the undersides of the {{wp|Elytron|elytra}} are yellow. It has a single pair of clear wings that can be folded underneath the elytra.

Ledian sleeps in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}} in the daytime inside a big leaf. When the stars flicker in the night sky, Ledian flutters about, scattering a glowing powder. It is considered good luck when one gets this powder stuck on them. The star patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky. It uses starlight as energy, though it also loves eating [[Berry|berries]]. It fights by throwing a {{m|Comet Punch|barrage of punches}} with its four arms; it uses quantity in an attempt to make up for its lack of strength in each punch.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ledian anime.png|thumb|220px|left|Ledian in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Ledian debuted in ''[[EP172|Mountain Time]]'', under the ownership of [[Benji]]. He and [[Benji's father|his father]] worked with their Pokémon in a mountain patrol.

Multiple wild Ledian worked together with other {{type|Bug}} Pokémon to save [[Mount Quena]] from {{TRT}} in ''[[Mewtwo Returns]]''.

A Ledian appeared in ''[[DP099|A Trainer and Child Reunion!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Ledian appeared in the {{pkmn2|wild}} in ''[[EP180|Houndoom's Special Delivery]]''.

Multiple Ledian appeared in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]'' as among the Pokémon living in the [[Tree of Beginning]].

A Ledian briefly appeared in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'' as one of the Pokémon {{OBP|Darkrai|M10}} hit with a {{m|Dark Void}} attack as the other Trainers were attacking him.

A Ledian appeared in ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]'' as one of the many local Pokémon living in [[Crown City]]. It worked together with several other Pokémon in surrounding {{mov|Zorua|Zorua|13}} at the park to attack him, angry for what {{mov|Zoroark|Zoroark|13}} did to the city. Before a fight broke out, Ledian, along with the other Pokémon, were calmed down by {{mov|Celebi|Celebi|13}}.

==In the manga==
[[File:Thorton Ledian Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Ledian in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS110|Piloswine Whine]]'', multiple Ledian under the control of {{tc|Team Rocket Grunt}}s attacked {{adv|Gold}} and {{adv|Silver}}, but were easily defeated.

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' a Ledian was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

{{FB|Factory Head|Thorton}} rented a Ledian for use in his battle against {{adv|Platinum}} in ''[[PS427|Uprooting Seedot]]''. It primarily used {{m|Baton Pass}} to power up its teammates.

In ''[[PS446|Weavile Wobbles But It Won't Fall Down]]'', a Trainer at the [[Johto Safari Zone|Safari Zone]] owns one.

===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Black and White Versions 2|Pokémon Black 2 and White 2]]: A Ledian appears as an antagonist in the [[Timegate Traveler Series|''Timegate Traveler'' movie series]]. In it, the Ledian plays a spear-wielding Ledian from the future where Pokémon {{pkmn|training|train}} humans.

==Trivia==
===Origin===
Ledian is based on a {{wp|Coccinellidae|ladybug}}. Its {{Shiny}} coloration seems to be based on ''{{wp|Coccinella transversalis}}''.

====Name origin====
Redian and Ledian may be a combination of the corrupted forms of ''ladybug'' or ''{{wp|ladybird}}'' and ''red''.
